alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Dubois; Martin; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 01 at 9:35PM EDT until April 02 at 10:53AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River near Bedford to Williams and White River at Hazleton to Petersburg. .While flooding continues along much of the White River and East fork of the White River, levels have crested and are steadily beginning to fall. More precipitation is in the forecast and this will result in prolonged flooding including a secondary rise in levels bringing some locations back above flood stage by early to mid next week. Those with interests along area waterways should monitor forecasts for the latest information. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...East Fork White River at Shoals. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Significant flooding of agricultural lands begins. Livestock in low bottoms must be moved to higher ground. Cemetery Road, East River Road, and SR 550 near Hindostan Church, and SR 257 south of Washington begins to flood. Water on Dubois CR 725 North in March 2011. Water receded from SR 550 during March 2011 on the south side of the river in the Loogootee area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 20.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM EDT Saturday was 22.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 5.2 feet Tuesday, April 11. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
